snippet: The Syrian government announced that Al Heffa, a village where a massacre had been feared, was now open to United Nations inspectors because it had been “cleansed.”
abstract: Syria announces that Al Heffa, a village where a massacre had been feared, is now open to United Nations inspectors because it has been 'cleansed' of armed terrorist gangs, the government's blanket term for the opposition.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Dalal Mawad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Syrian government announced that Al Heffa, a village where a massacre had been feared, was now open to United Nations inspectors because it had been “cleansed.”

headline.seo: Syria Says It Has ‘Cleansed’ Al Heffa
headline.main: U.N. Kept Out of a Town That Syria Says It ‘Cleansed’
headline.print_headline: U.N. Kept Out of a Town That Syria Says It ‘Cleansed’

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
